title: Colour Spray
content:
Colour Spray Level 1 Illusion Spell Blind creatures up to a combined 33 hit points. 1 turn 5m Action Level 1 Spell Slot

Level 1 Illusion Spell

Blind creatures up to a combined 33 hit points.

Colour spray is a Spell in Baldur's Gate 3. Colour spray is a Lvl 1 Spell from the Illusion school. Spells can be used for dealing damage to Enemies, inflict Status Ailments, buff Characters or interact with the environment.

Colour Spray Information

Description: Blind creatures up to a combined 33 hit points. Level: Lvl 1 Spell School: Illusion Casting Time: Action Range: 5m/17ft Requires Concentration: No Saving Throw: None Additional Details: Affects a 17ft cone area.

Colour Spray (Condition)

Duration: 1 Turn

Ranged attacks and spells have a range of 15ft and attack rolls suffer disadvantage. Attack rolls against Blinded creatures have advantage.

How to Acquire Colour Spray

Colour spray can be acquired by the following classes:

Eldritch Knight Sorcerer Wizard Arcane Trickster (Rogue Subclass) Abjuration School (Wizard Subclass) Evocation School (Wizard Subclass) Necromancy School (Wizard Subclass) Conjuration School (Wizard Subclass) Enchantment School (Wizard Subclass) Divination School (Wizard Subclass) Illusion School (Wizard Subclass) Transmutation School (Wizard Subclass)

Colour spray can be cast by using the following Items:

Ring of Colour Spray (found in Harpy Nest behind Druid Temple)

Colour Spray Tips & Notes

Blinded creatures are unable to make attacks of opportunity.

Differences from D&D 5th Edition:

Area is a 15ft cone rather than a 17ft cone. Affects a combined hit point total of 6d10; 33 is the average. The effect lasts until the end of the caster's next turn, rather than the effect expiring at the end of each target's next turn.
